title: WPP Settles Lawsuit Alleging Misconduct by Former Ad-Agency Head
text:
WPP PLC has settled a lawsuit brought by an employee that alleged racist and sexist behavior by a top executive at one of the advertising giantâ€™s premier agencies, ending a legal dispute that helped raise awareness about inappropriate behavior on Madison Avenue.
Erin Johnson, chief communications officer of the WPP-owned agency J. Walter Thompson, is receiving a substantial settlement, a person familiar with the matter told The Wall Street Journal, which first reported news of the agreement Wednesday.
